Generation I.Red: Uses its three brains to execute complex plans. While two heads sleep, one head stays awake.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Uses its three brains to execute complex plans. While two heads sleep, one head stays awake.
Generation I.Yellow: One of Doduo 's 2 heads splits to form a unique species. It runs close to 40 MPH in prairies.
Generation I.Stadium: The three heads express joy, sorrow and anger as they plan strategy together. When it sleeps, one head remains awake.

Generation II.Gold: It collects data and plans three times as wisely, but it may think too much and become immobilized.
Generation II.Silver: If one of the heads gets to eat, the others will be satisfied, too, and they will stop squabbling.
Generation II.Crystal: An enemy that takes its eyes off any of the three heads--even for a second--will get pecked severely.
Generation II.Stadium 2: It collects data and plans three times as wisely, but it may think too much and become immobilized. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) If one of the heads gets to eat, the others will be satisfied, too, and they will stop squabbling. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Watch out if Dodrio 's three heads are looking in three separate directions. It's a sure sign that it is on its guard. Don't go near this Pok é mon if it's being wary -it may decide to peck you.
Generation III.Sapphire: Apparently, the heads aren't the only parts of the body that Dodrio has three of. It has three sets of hearts and lungs as well, so it is capable of running long distances without rest.
Generation III.Emerald: A peculiar Pok é mon species with three heads. It vigorously races across grassy plains even in arid seasons with little rainfall.
Generation III.FireRed: An odd species that is rarely found. The three heads respectively represent joy, sadness, and anger.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Uses its three brains to execute complex plans. While two heads sleep, one head is said to stay awake.

Generation IV.Diamond: When Doduo evolves into this odd breed, one of its heads splits into two. It runs at nearly 40 mph .
Generation IV.Pearl: When Doduo evolves into this odd breed, one of its heads splits into two. It runs at nearly 40 mph .
Generation IV.Platinum: When Doduo evolves into this odd breed, one of its heads splits into two. It runs at nearly 40 mph .
Generation IV.HeartGold: It collects data and plans three times as wisely, but it may think too much and fall into a state of immobility.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: If one of the heads gets to eat, the others will be satisfied, too, and they will stop squabbling.

Generation V.Black: When Doduo evolves into this odd breed, one of its heads splits into two. It runs at nearly 40 mph .
Generation V.White: When Doduo evolves into this odd breed, one of its heads splits into two. It runs at nearly 40 mph .
Generation V.Black 2: When Doduo evolves into this odd breed, one of its heads splits into two. It runs at nearly 40 mph .
Generation V.White 2: When Doduo evolves into this odd breed, one of its heads splits into two. It runs at nearly 40 mph .

Generation VI.X: An enemy that takes its eyes off any of the three heads--even for a second--will get pecked severely.
Generation VI.Y: An odd species that is rarely found. The three heads respectively represent joy, sadness, and anger.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Watch out if Dodrio's three heads are looking in three separate directions. It's a sure sign that it is on its guard. Don't go near this Pokémon if it's being wary—it may decide to peck you.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Apparently, the heads aren't the only parts of the body that Dodrio has three of. It has three sets of hearts and lungs as well, so it is capable of running long distances without rest.

Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: One of Doduo's two heads splits to form a unique species. It runs close to 40 mph in prairies.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: One of Doduo's two heads splits to form a unique species. It runs close to 40 mph in prairies.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: When Doduo evolves into this odd breed, one of its heads splits into two. This Pokémon runs at nearly 40 mph .
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: When Doduo evolves into this odd breed, one of its heads splits into two. This Pokémon runs at nearly 40 mph .

Generation IX.Scarlet: It now has three hearts and three sets of lungs. Though it can’t run as fast as Doduo, Dodrio can keep running for longer stretches of time.
Generation IX.Violet: The strongest head with the thickest neck becomes the leader and gains primary control of the body.

Generation II.Gold: Routes 26 and 28 , Mt. Silver Morning Day
Generation II.Silver: Routes 27 and 28 , Mt. Silver Morning Day
Generation II.Crystal: Routes 27 and 28 , Mt. Silver Morning Day Trade Dragonair ♀ in Blackthorn City

Generation IV.SoulSilver: Routes 27 and 28 , Mt. Silver Safari Zone (tall grass in Rocky Beach with 10 Plains points) Trade Dragonair ♀ in Blackthorn City
